properties.description: Posted by BpremoFoxborough, MAWe went to see Mudvayne in Foxborough on the Metallica Summer Sanitarium Tour. One of the ppl on the trip was running late so we got a late start. I drove about 95 mph the whole way from Albany, NY to the stadium, at one point we drove up the breakdown lane to get into the parking lot. We sprinted from the car into the stadium just as Mudvayne took the stage so we didn\'t miss any of their performance!!! They kicked major ass that day!

properties.name: Ozz Fest 05  Cricket Pavilion
properties.description: Posted by Drummer212121 North 83rd Ave Phoenix, Az 85035My drum instructor introduced me to LD 50 when I first started taking private lessons. He showed me the brilliance in Matt\'s drumming. I was 14 at the time and fell in love with mudvayne. I loved everything about them. I admired the band\'s thinking strategies and their approach to all of their albums. Ozz Fest 2005 was my first time seeing Mudvayne. They just put out "Lost and Found" and again, that album brought out another dimension to Mudvayne. The band has a bright future ahead of them because they remain so close as individuals and they dont let anything bring them down! 1 singer in two bands would never work out in any other average band!! Chad Gray does an amazing job of keeping both Mudvayne and HELLYEAH strong. Only true fans understand Mudvayne and understand why they do what they do and why every single album has different dimensions. You have to be on the same thinking level as the band so when they say or do something, you can say, "Oh, that makes sense!" I thank Jimbo Mcallister, my drum teacher when I was 14 years old, for introducing me to mudvayne because I now introduce MY students to Mudvayne. I know Jimbo would me proud of me now. Music is amazing. If everyone had the thought process like Mudvayne, this world would be much differnent. Thank You Mudvayne :) -Josh Montanez jtmdrummer@hotmail.com My Myspace wasdeleted :(

properties.name: Sydney Australia
properties.description: Posted by Mudvayne8meganMudvayne played in sydney australia on the 24th of january 2006. Best concert i have ever been to in my life! I was just 13 years of age and had never experienced a mosh pit before, i was thrown right into the deep end. They also opened with Under My Skin so theres even more of an experience. Chad Gray to me is the most brilliant man in the entire world, he is everything i thought he\'d be and more. Thank you so much Chad. and thank you so much Mudvayne you have changed my life for the best. -Mudvayne Megan (yeah its me from australia chad and greg the girl who gave you the hats :D)

properties.description: Posted by MudchickaddressThe best Mudvayne Memory would have to be seeing the guys in New Orleans in 2005 at a club and Chad talking about the soldiers and my brother was just sent to Korea and then they played World So Cold and when he sang the lines "Hold the hand of your best friend, look into their eyes and watch them drift away" he was holding my hand and looking me in my eyes! That was pretty cool. Then a few months later I met the guys in Houston during Ozzfest and Chad told me his eyes loved me!!!

properties.name: earthlink live april 17, 2005
properties.description: Posted by Mirandadollatlanta,gaI went to the mudvayne concert and i waited all day..we were like the first people there waiting..we got posters and balloons and a lot of free stuff for just being there so early. I met some radio host from around there. Then when we finally got to go in, the first fifty people that bought the new cd got to get a backstage pass after the show. My friends and I got the passes. We loved the show and afterwards we met the members of mudvayne! I got ditched by my friends so I was a little worried while standing in line to meet them. When i got to chad he gave me a hug and i was so amazed he did that. It made my night but the concert was so extraordinary and I will never forget it.
